Key Match Events: Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a stunning free-kick to double England's lead
Declan Rice tapped in Ollie Watkins cross to add a third for England
Arttu Hoskonen headed one back for Finland from a corner
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley emphasized the importance of getting a reaction from the team after the disappointing defeat to Greece
The team played with a more conventional formation
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley was happy to get things back on track with the win
Jack Grealish praised the team's performance and said they were a bit gutted to concede from a set-piece
Declan Rice emphasized that he was 'buzzing' for Jack Grealish and that the team was'really buying into what they want to do'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Grealish revealed he owes Trent Alexander-Arnold Â£500 after making a bet with him over the free-kick
The team had massive possession and created a lot of chances, but Lee Carsley thought they could still be better
Others: Lee Carsley's comments on the England job and his future as manager continue to raise questions
Ian Wright and Roy Keane had differing opinions on the team's performance, with Keane criticizing Trent Alexander-Arnold's defensive play and Wright expressing worry over the team's transition
